text:
SEO agency here. We set yearly OKRs with our managers, input our OKRs into ClickUp, and track the specific key results there as tasks so we have something we can point to when giving bonuses up to 10% of base salary (which happen in December).

Pre-pandemic, our bonuses were pretty squishy and subjective (â€œYou did a great job, hereâ€™s 10% of your salary!â€œ) but now we have some accountability.

Our OKRs are generally growth-driven, so itâ€™s not just Doing Your Job. Things like learning a new skill, building a new process, or onboarding a new client (for ppl interested in making it rain) but the OKRs are tailored to the department in which we work.

SEO agency here. We set yearly OKRs with our managers, input our OKRs into ClickUp, and track the specific key results there as tasks so we have something we can point to when giving bonuses up to 10% of base salary (which happen in December).

Pre-pandemic, our bonuses were pretty squishy and subjective (â€œYou did a great job, hereâ€™s 10% of your salary!â€œ) but now we have some accountability.

Our OKRs are generally growth-driven, so itâ€™s not just Doing Your Job. Things like learning a new skill, building a new process, or onboarding a new client (for ppl interested in making it rain) but the OKRs are tailored to the department in which we work.

text:
A lot of people are navigating health setbacks, as well as unspoken/unseen struggles. You are not alone â€” there is light at the end of your tunnel. In my experience, "rock bottom" moments lead to the formation of new mountains.

I wrote this article in 2016, and updated/published it recently, to support my peers and friends who may be suffering in silence: <https://www.ritikamonster.com/blog/founder-nightmare>

It took me five years to publish. Little did I know, at the time, that my demons had not been "put to rest." It wasn't one of those stories where I simply bounced back. What I experienced as a radical, profound shift to who I was fundamentally, as a human being. The process meant making a lost of mistakes, doubling down on my best attributes, and confronting the worst sides of who I was, head-on.

I'll likely write or vlog about this experience later. In the meantime, I hope this resource is helpful to someone on the other side of the screen, in the expansive universe of the "internetz."

As I reflect on the journey, I think of these experiences as my profound moments of enlightenment. Just know that with every step forward, you are moving towards a destination.

attachments.title: So, my founder nightmare came true â€” Write with Ritikamonster :muscle:
attachments.text: What I thought was a tiny injury landed me in the hospitalâ€”no big deal. But a series of tests led my doctors down a path that I never could have imagined. Flash forward. Weâ€™re okay. Weâ€™re stronger than ever. Weâ€™re proud of what we built and are moving forward. Things never went back to the way that
